intro: Coryphantha difficilis, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial cactus-like plant characterized by its dense, woolly covering of pale green to grayish-white hair. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open plains. Coryphantha difficilis is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and minimal rainfall, making it a hardy species of the desert ecosystem.
